snippet: A judge ordered Hattiesburg on Thursday to stage a special mayoral election after accusations of fraud led to a protracted legal dispute.
abstract: Mississippi Judge William F Coleman orders Hattiesburg to stage special mayoral election after accusations of fraud led to a protracted legal dispute; Mayor Johnny L DuPree won June election by 37 votes, but lawyers for his challenger Dave Ware say widespread misconduct had allowed DuPree to win.
lead_paragraph: A judge ordered Hattiesburg on Thursday to stage a special mayoral election after accusations of fraud led to a protracted legal dispute.
